intro: Antirrhinum confertum, commonly known as the clustered snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small, clustered flowers along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Antirrhinum confertum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
